title: 106_s2243
content: The Act titled "National Women's Business Council Reauthorization Act of 2000" amends the duties of the Council outlined in the Women's Business Ownership Act of 1988. The National Women's Business Council shall provide advice on economic matters, promote initiatives for women business owners, serve as a catalyst for women's business development, promote policy agendas, and review programs affecting women-owned small businesses' access to capital and credit. The National Women's Business Council supports women-owned small businesses by assisting in obtaining capital and credit, working with federal agencies and the private sector to increase contracting opportunities, promoting women's business census and research, and monitoring government programs for business growth. The National Women's Business Council supports women's business enterprise by developing new initiatives, policies, programs, and plans to foster women's business ownership. They also advise and consult with State and local leaders to implement programs and policies that promote women's business ownership. The Council interacts with the Interagency Committee on Women's Business Enterprise to advise on activities, functions, and policies. The National Women's Business Council meets regularly to make recommendations and submit reports to various government bodies, including the President and congressional committees. They aim to support women's business ownership through initiatives and policies. The National Women's Business Council submits detailed reports on its activities, findings, recommendations, and legislative suggestions to promote women-owned small businesses. The Administrator may include additional views or recommendations in separate submissions. The National Women's Business Council submits reports with recommendations to promote women-owned small businesses, including additional views or recommendations submitted separately. The Women's Business Ownership Act of 1988 is amended to update membership requirements for the Council, including changes to subsections (a), (b), (d), and (h). The Women's Business Ownership Act of 1988 is amended to focus on developing state and local economic networks for women's business enterprises and conducting studies, research, and issue initiatives. The Women's Business Ownership Act of 1988 is amended to authorize the Council to conduct studies and initiatives related to awarding contracts to women-owned businesses and improving access to credit and business development assistance programs for women entrepreneurs. This includes focused outreach initiatives in nontraditional industry sectors to increase contract awards to women. The Women's Business Ownership Act of 1988 is amended to authorize the Council to conduct studies and initiatives related to awarding contracts to women-owned businesses, improving access to credit, and developing programs for women entrepreneurs. This includes outreach in nontraditional sectors to increase contract awards to women and working with Women's Business Centers to coordinate activities. Section 411 of the Women's Business Ownership Act of 1988 is amended to authorize appropriations of $1,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2001 to 2003. $550,000 will be allocated annually for sections 409 and 410, with a requirement for budget review before funds can be used by the Council.
